New Year Snowmentime limit per test2 secondsmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstdinoutputstdoutAs meticulous Gerald sets the table and caring Alexander sends the postcards, Sergey makes snowmen. Each showman should consist of three snowballs: a big one, a medium one and a small one. Sergey's twins help him: they've already madensnowballs with radii equal tor1,r2, ...,rn. To make a snowman, one needs any three snowballs whose radii are pairwise different. For example, the balls with radii1,2and3can be used to make a snowman but2,2,3or2,2,2cannot. Help Sergey and his twins to determine whatmaximumnumber of snowmen they can make from those snowballs.InputThe first line contains integern(1 ≤n≤ 105) — the number of snowballs. The next line containsnintegers — the balls' radiir1,r2, ...,rn(1 ≤ri≤ 109). The balls' radii can coincide.OutputPrint on the first line a single numberk— the maximum number of the snowmen. The description of each snowman should consist of three space-separated numbers — the big ball's radius, the medium ball's radius and the small ball's radius. processed.result:
You are given a list of $n$ integers ($1 \le n \le 10^5$) representing the radii of snowballs. Each integer $r_i$ ($1 \le r_i \le 10^9$) represents the radius of a single snowball.

Determine the maximum number of snowmen that can be made from these snowballs. A snowman requires three snowballs with distinct radii (i.e., no two snowballs can have the same radius).

Output the maximum number of snowmen that can be made, followed by a list of the snowmen's radii. Each snowman is represented by three space-separated integers: the radius of the largest snowball, the radius of the medium snowball, and the radius of the smallest snowball. 



If there are multiple solutions, output any one of them.

You are given a list of numbers representing the sizes of snowballs.  Find the maximum number of sets of three different sizes you can make from the list, where each set represents a snowman.  Output the maximum number of snowmen and list one possible combination of snowballs for each snowman.
